name: Sriracha
description: A type of hot sauce or chili sauce made from a paste of chili peppers, distilled vinegar, garlic, sugar, and salt.

name: Avocado
description: A fruit with a creamy texture and a single large seed, known for its rich, buttery, and mildly nutty flavor.

name: Bacon
description: A type of salt-cured pork, typically cut into thin strips and pan-fried or baked until crispy.

name: Balsamic Vinegar
description: A dark, concentrated, and intensely flavored vinegar originating in Italy, made wholly or partially from grape must.

name: Blue Cheese
description: A classification of cheeses that have had cultures of the mold Penicillium added so the final product is spotted or veined.

name: Broccoli
description: An edible green plant in the cabbage family whose large flowering head, stalk, and small associated leaves are eaten as a vegetable.

name: Butter
description: A dairy product made from the fat and protein components of churned cream.

name: Potato Chips
description: Thin slices of potato that have been either deep-fried or baked until crunchy. They are commonly served as a snack.

name: Ketchup
description: A sweet and tangy table sauce typically made from tomatoes, sugar, vinegar, and seasonings.

name: Wasabi
description: A plant of the Brassicaceae family, which includes cabbages and horseradish. Its rhizome is used as a pungent condiment.

name: Olives
description: A small oval fruit with a hard stone and bitter flesh, green when unripe and bluish-black when ripe, used as food and as a source of oil.

name: Honey
description: A sweet, viscous food substance produced by honey bees and some related insects.

name: Greek Yogurt
description: A type of yogurt which has been strained to remove most of its whey, resulting in a thicker consistency and a tart flavor.

name: Espresso
description: A full-flavored, concentrated form of coffee that is served in "shots."

name: Pad Thai
description: A stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served as a street food and at casual local eateries in Thailand.

name: Pickles
description: A cucumber that has been pickled in a brine, vinegar, or other solution and left to ferment for a period of time.

name: Tofu
description: A food prepared by coagulating soy milk and then pressing the resulting curds into solid white blocks of varying softness.

name: Ginger
description: A flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root or ginger, is widely used as a spice and a folk medicine.

name: Mango
description: A stone fruit produced from numerous species of tropical trees, known for its sweet and sometimes tangy taste.

name: Miso Soup
description: A traditional Japanese soup consisting of a dashi stock into which softened miso paste is mixed.

name: Guacamole
description: An avocado-based dip, spread, or salad first developed in Mexico, often containing lime juice, cilantro, and onions.

name: Salmon
description: A common food fish classified as an oily fish with a rich content of protein and omega-3 fatty acids.

name: Red Wine
description: An alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes, known for its complex flavor profile that can include notes of fruit, oak, and tannins.

name: Kale
description: A green, leafy, cruciferous vegetable that is rich in nutrients, with a slightly bitter, earthy flavor.

name: Sourdough Bread
description: A bread made by the fermentation of dough using naturally occurring lactobacilli and yeast, known for its characteristic tangy taste.

name: Hummus
description: A Middle Eastern dip, spread, or savory dish made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.

name: Tiramisu
description: A coffee-flavoured Italian dessert made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese.

name: Artichoke
description: A variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food, with a tender heart and a mild, slightly nutty flavor.

name: Steak
description: A cut of meat, typically beef, sliced perpendicular to the muscle fibers and grilled or fried.

name: Lime
description: A citrus fruit which is typically round, green in color, and contains acidic juice vesicles.

name: Mayonnaise
description: A thick, cold, and creamy sauce or dressing commonly used on sandwiches and composed salads, made from oil, egg yolk, and an acid.

name: Mustard
description: A condiment made from whole, ground, or cracked mustard seeds, mixed with water, vinegar, or other liquids.

name: Onion
description: A vegetable that is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium, known for its pungent and sharp flavor.

name: Orange Juice
description: The liquid extract of the fruit of the orange tree, produced by squeezing or reaming oranges.

name: Peanut Butter
description: A food paste or spread made from ground, dry-roasted peanuts.

name: Popcorn
description: A variety of corn kernel which expands and puffs up when heated.

name: Quinoa
description: A flowering plant in the amaranth family. It is a herbaceous annual plant grown as a crop primarily for its edible seeds.

name: Raspberry
description: An edible soft fruit, consisting of a cluster of reddish-pink drupelets.

name: Rice (White)
description: The polished seed of the grass species Oryza sativa. As a cereal grain, it is the most widely consumed staple food for a large part of the world's human population.

name: Sauerkraut
description: Finely cut raw cabbage that has been fermented by various lactic acid bacteria, with a distinct sour flavor.

name: Shrimp
description: Decapod crustaceans with elongated bodies, commonly used in cooking and known for their mildly sweet and savory flavor.

name: Spinach
description: A leafy green flowering plant native to central and western Asia, with a mild, slightly earthy taste.

name: Strawberry
description: A widely grown hybrid species of the genus Fragaria, known for its characteristic aroma, bright red color, juicy texture, and sweetness.

name: Sweet Potato
description: A large, starchy, sweet-tasting, tuberous root vegetable.

name: Tuna (Canned)
description: A saltwater fish that belongs to the mackerel family, preserved in a can, often in oil or water.

name: Turkey (Roasted)
description: The meat from a large bird, especially one that is raised for food, cooked with dry heat in an oven.

name: Watermelon
description: A large fruit of a plant of the gourd family, with smooth green skin, reddish pulp, and watery juice.

name: Cilantro
description: An annual herb in the family Apiaceae. All parts of the plant are edible, but the fresh leaves and the dried seeds are the parts most traditionally used in cooking.

name: Anchovies
description: A small, common forage fish of the family Engraulidae, often salt-cured and packed in oil.

name: Chickpeas
description: An annual legume of the family Fabaceae, also known as garbanzo bean, with a nutty taste and granular texture.
